Legal_Issue: Whether the Refugee Division properly applied ss. 69.1(6) and 69.1(11) of the Immigration Act
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, ss. 69.1(6) and 69.1(11)
Application_Facts: Applicant missed April 7 hearing but attended May 10 hearing; provided excuse of mistaken date
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Defendant_Behavior: Failed to appear at scheduled hearing without sufficient justification
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to attend hearing and insufficient explanation for absence
Legal_Standard: Reasonable opportunity to explain absence; adequacy of written reasons
Assessment_Factor: Credibility of excuse for missing hearing
Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, ss. 69.1(6), 69.1(11)
Procedural_Issue: Compliance with procedural fairness and statutory requirements
Credibility_Assessment: Board found applicant's reason for absence insufficient
Application_Basis: Statutory provisions on abandonment of refugee claims
Evidence_Assessed: Oral explanation provided at subsequent hearing
Relief_Sought: Certification of a question under s. 18(1) or quashing of decision
Governing_Rule: Under ss. 69.1(6), failure to appear after reasonable opportunity leads to abandonment; ss. 69.1(11) requires written reasons
Harm_Assessment: No harm established due to procedural compliance
Cause_Description: Applicant's failure to attend initial hearing and insufficient justification
Evidence_Handling: Board considered explanation but found it inadequate
Legal_Provision_Violated: ss. 69.1(6) and 69.1(11) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Issues: Lack of corroborating evidence for mistaken date claim
Evidence_Assessment: Minimal reasoning but referenced key facts and legal requirements
Decision_Rationale: Applicant failed to appear and did not provide adequate explanation; decision included required legal elements
Evidentiary_Issues: Limited detail in written reasons, but sufficient for review
